snippet: Ammar Cheikh Omar, who returned to his parents’ homeland from Germany, said he was forced to shoot at protesters and witness torture.
abstract: Ammar Cheikh Omar is one of thousands of Syrians who inadvertently found themselves deployed as foot soldiers for the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad, one that the United Nations estimates has killed more than 5,000 people since crackdown on demonstrators began; Omar says his orders to shoot, kill and torture protesters led him to defect.
lead_paragraph: Ammar Cheikh Omar, who returned to his parents’ homeland from Germany, said he was forced to shoot at protesters and witness torture.

headline.seo: Soldier Says Syrian Atrocities Forced Him to Defect
headline.main: Soldier Says Syrian Atrocities Forced Him to Defect
headline.print_headline: Soldier Says Syrian Shootings and Torture Led Him to Defect
